name: places/ChIJt5cZkgL2wokRQJ7wbyLmh0I
formattedAddress: 201 E 104th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 201 E 104th St, New York, NY 10029-5418, USA

originalText.text: HORRIBLE!! First, they moved.. to down town. They arent located here anymore. I went for them to do xrays and cleaning and they told me come back in a year despite me knowing i had cavities that needed to be taken care of. Flash forward a year.. now I have extreme tooth pain, so I called for an appointment. They gave me an appointment a month away. Anyone who knows tooth pain knows that's like a whole year! So I agreed to the appointment because they took my insurance. Kept calling to see of anyone canceled. Called last week and was told no (with an attitude like im bothering her when im the one in pain), gotta wait until Jan 4th. Today I got a call and she didn't even tell me where she was from. Just said "Hi you have an appointment on Jan 4th, but we don't take your insurance anymore so we're going to have to cancel you." I was half sleep so I said.. umm ok and hung up and then realized I had no freaking clue where tf she called from. I had to go through my planner and see which appointments I had on the 4th and then realized I had 2 and had to call the number back to figure out who even called me. Very unprofessional. Wouldn't recommend!

originalText.text:
3 years I went here for cleaning before kidney transplant.   Receptionist was sort not impressed with me.  I was seen by female dentists after x-ray.   She seemed helpful and nice
She referred me to have 2 molars extra to surgeon at 106 Street.  I went to surgeon.   The longest waiting period.   Filled forms.  When called and x-rayed Sat down awaiting surgeon who was still with other patients.  Once he came and check my forms and x-rays he seem a bit Standish to start with me.  He explained molars and extraction but only proceeded to remove part of molar.  Finished and didn't want to extract other molar.  So of course I went back to original dentist only to find she was not my dentist.   I got another male young dentist who had seemed to explained x-rays and proceeded to clean teeth.   Which wasn't a great experience.  But I needed this.   After Finished I was dismissed to go to another patient.   I asked receptionist for another appointment and was told because of insurance at time only coverage was for cleaning and x-rays every 1 time a year.   I went home feeling unsatisfying.   I proceeded to call after year.  And never got returned calls.   Now it's almost 4 years and no word from them at all.  I felt they discriminated for illness and insurance.   Not professional.

originalText.text:
My experience was terrible ! I wish i could give a negative number of stars. I arrived at 1:38 for a 2 pm appointment.  The receptionist was shoving food down her face. I said it was my first time and was told i didn't have an appointment.  I canvassed the neighborhood for the next 10 minutes thinking i might've made an error but i know myself better than that so i returned. When i came back that same receptionist told me my name wasn't anywhere in the system but when she looked by my phone number, my appointment was scheduled with all my information but someone else's name !
I received the most painful cleaning in my life. When i left I needed a referral and guess what? The same receptionist hands me a referral with information that looked foreign to me.  She handed me someone else's referral! I asked who is this ?! She gives me the right paper but no apologies for multiple errors.  I am disgusted with this practice.

originalText.text: Very good staff! The doctor is also amazingly friendly, she would talk to you with comfort throughout your visit but the only bad part you would have to deal with is trying to get someone to pick up or reschedule an appointment. Could be a bad experience with me? Maybe just bad luck but has anyone else had this problem before? Let us know otherwise this is the fastest dental work you’d ever get in the city. Just never miss an appointment and think you’ll call in to reschedule

originalText.text: I'm writing to express my gratitude to Dr. Weinstock for the amazing dental care I received at East Harlem Dental Associates. From the moment I arrived I was made to feel completely comfortable by the entire staff. These people are true professionals in every sense of the word, and I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone in the area looking for top of the line dental care.
